main event: A weather observer reported sighting 4 disc-shaped objects at high altitude in Yuma City, Arizona on February 3, 1953.
interesting points: The objects were seen moving rapidly and disappeared from sight., Witness described the objects as having a solid dull white color with a thin white mist around the edges., The observer was using a theodolite to track a weather balloon when the objects appeared., The report noted that the objects could not be balloons because they moved against the wind., It was a clear day with cirrus clouds in the sky during the sighting.
witness description: Meteorological Aid with 10 years of experience.
